bibl.title: John Leonard v. State of Washington. Writ of Habeus Corpus.
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

div1.p: ninety -six, purposefully, and of his deliberate and premeditated malice killed Jacob Malquist by then and there purposelyand of his deliber- ate and premediated malice, striking, beating and mortally wounding the said Jacob Malquist upon the head of him the said Jacob Malquist, with a piece of wood of the length of thirty inches, and of the width of three inches, and of the thickness of three inches, which said piece of wood he the said John Leanord, in his hands then and there had and held, contrary to the form of the statute in such cases made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the state of Wash- ington. Dated at Colfax this 29th day of July, A.D. 1896. H.W. Canfield, Prosecuting and County Attorney, in and for said County and State

State of Washington, County of Whitman, H.W. Canfield, being first duly sworn on oath says, he is the duly elected, acting and qualified Prosecuting and County Attorney, in and for said County and State, that he has read the foregoing in- formation, knows the contents thereof and believes the same to be true. H.W. Canfield SUBSCRIBED AND SWORN TO BEFORE ME THIS "29TH DAY OF JULY, 1896. C. A. R O S S Clerk of said Whitman County, Washington.

WITNESSES: Ed Lewis, W.H. Steuart, C.O. Anderyson, Mrs. P. M. Sil- cott, Mrs. W.H. Steuart, Thos. Boling, Frank Perry, A.P. Brown, Roger Morrisy, James Barry, W.S. Elliott, Fred Bonney, Thos. Mosgrove J.D. Whiteis, C.M. Boswell, R.J. Skaife, John K. Eacho, T.W.Os- borne, D.H. Shaw, O Hansen.

Third- That thereafter such proceedings were had and taken in said cause in the Superior Court of Whitman County, State of Washing ton, that the jury which was impanelled and sworn to try the said pe- titioner upon the said charge in the said informatin, did on the 21st day of Aug. 1896, render and return into the said Superior Court their verdict in said cause, which is in writing in words and figures as follows, to-wit; IN THE SUPERIOR COURT OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON IN AND FOR THE COUNTY OFWHITMAN. The State of Washington, Plaintiff, vs. John Leonard, Defendant. We the jury in the case of the State of Washington, plaintiff, a- gainst John Leonard, defendant, find the defendant guilty of the crime of murder in the First Degree as charged in the information. Paul Bockmier, Foreman.
